body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth             Kids & Youth        Kids birdwatching at Sitka National Historical Park NPS / Katy Kildee       Explore Sitka National Historical Park! Kids can have a great time exploring the park with their families and friends! Here are some ideas for your visit:  Check out the exhibits and film at our visitor center.  Participate in any of our regularly scheduled ranger programs.  Take a stroll along the park trail to see the totem poles and the spawning salmon.  Borrow a family fun pack to explore the beach.  And with a little work, you can even become a Sitka National Historical Park Junior Ranger!        If You Can't Visit ... If you can't visit the park, there are many online resources for learning about Sitka National Historical Park and the National Park Service.  Fun activities, games, and puzzles can be found on the Park Fun section of this website. If you are writing a school report, or just want to learn more, visit the History & Culture, Nature & Science, and Plan Your Visit sections of this website.  For pictures of the park, check out our Photos and Multimedia!
title: Sitka National Historical Park: Kids & Youth
